content.question: Which of the following best describes the legal ruling in the 1950s that made possible the situation in the images?

choices.label: The decision in Dred Scott v. Sandford made segregating students in public schools illegal.
Unequal access to a quality education violated the equal protection clause of the Fourteenth Amendment.
States with segregated schools used laws from before the Civil War that no longer applied to modern society.
The Thirteenth Amendment rendered discriminating against students based on race unconstitutional.

content.answer: Unequal access to a quality education violated the equal protection clause of the Fourteenth Amendment.
